{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3484361,"name":"Andrii Bessarab","username":"andriibessarab","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andriibessarab/{size}/258546_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-16T12:24:18.371Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone!

My team and I were setting up our new radio, the VH-109.

We were updating the firmware. When we began the upload through radio.local, the button turned white and then, about ten seconds later, went back to being blue, which led me to think the update was over. Hence, I decided to power cycle the robot.

I then found out that we were supposed to wait a couple of minutes until

PWR light is solid and the SYS light is slowly blinking at 1 Hz

Due to the interruption, we are now unable to access the radio’s web server. We went through all the troubleshooting steps suggested at WPILIB Programming your Radio, and nothing seemed to help.

Here is the error that VH Network Assistant throws:

Screenshot 2025-01-16 071228806×460 5.73 KB

Note that we were successfully able to ping the radio; however, the web server refuses the connection. A friend of mine even tried a bunch of other web ports, and none seem to connect either.

If anyone has come across the same issue or has any suggestions in general, we would appreciate any ideas on what we should try, as we are currently out of ideas.

Ill start with I don’t have any ideas to solve your problem, this is likely needing official support for the VH-109

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/getting-started/support

That said…

I wanted to point out a positive behavior you are displaying.

We all make mistakes. It’s natural to be embarrassed and want to hide it.

But you are owning it, and in a very public way. That is something that when it’s important will serve you well in life. Because you are accurately reporting your situation those that develop the firmware and process for this device may choose to make changes to make the lights less confusing. Or make the notice of the process in the documentation more obvious, or force an acknowledge button to proceed, any number of solutions to prevent what happened to you from happening to someone else.

Furthermore it’s easy for people to help you and trust you because you have told the truth.

I just wanted to point this out as it’s something you may not have thought deeply about. We all make mistakes, own it, so we can accurately fix it, and move on.

When you lie is when you break trust, and that’s harder to recover from/build back than fixing the radio.

Thank you so much for your encouraging words!

I will contact the official support team later today to see if they can help. I also want to see if any other teams have encountered the same issue and have found a solution.

This is 100% a remote support issue. As long as you don’t touch it any further or try anything too wild, someone on my team can get this fixed in minutes.

Please check your DM.

For other teams who run into the same problem, we resolved the issue by:

  1. Emailing support. The email can be found here.
  2. Installing the remote support software (it’s really just Anydesk). The installation is here.
  3. Coordinating the time with the support team for when you have access to the radio. They can fix it in about five minutes.
